original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.20. Kusalattika, Cittasamuṭṭhānaduka🔽Kusalaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nacittasamuṭṭhāno dhammo uppajjati🔽hetupaccayā. Kusalaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naabyākato nacittasamuṭṭhāno🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Kusalaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo🔽nacittasamuṭṭhāno ca naabyākato nacittasamuṭṭhāno ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Akusalaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nacittasamuṭṭhāno dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  kusala ttika citta samuṭṭhāna duka  kusalam citta samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na citta samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati  hetu paccayā kusalam citta samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca na abyākataḥ na citta samuṭṭhāno  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā kusalam citta samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ  na citta samuṭṭhāno ca na abyākataḥ na citta samuṭṭhāno ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi  akusalam citta samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na citta samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati

original: hetupaccayā. Akusalaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naabyākato nacittasamuṭṭhāno🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Akusalaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo

original: nacittasamuṭṭhāno ca naabyākato nacittasamuṭṭhāno ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na citta samuṭṭhāno ca na abyākataḥ na citta samuṭṭhāno ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: and neither mind-element nor neutral mind-originated things … (as above, in § 1, but with the addition of the third permutation, “neither mind-element nor neutral mind-originated things,” after each of the three permutations in § 1.)

original: Abyākataṁ cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nacittasamuṭṭhāno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: abyākatam citta samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na citta samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: Neutral mind-originated things … (as above, in § 1, but with the addition of the third permutation, “neither mind-element nor neutral mind-originated things,” after each of the three permutations in § 1.)

original: Hetuyā nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate nava.🔽Kusalaṁ nocittasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nanocittasamuṭṭhāno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … pañca.🔽Akusalaṁ nocittasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nanocittasamuṭṭhāno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … pañca.
analyzed: hetuyāḥ nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate nava  kusalam no citta samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na no citta samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pañca  akusalam no citta samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na no citta samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pañca
translated: In the section on root cause, there are nine. … In the section on kamma result, there are three. … In the section on the inconstant, there are nine.🔽A wholesome, not mind-originated thing … (as above, in § 1, but with the addition of the third permutation, “neither mind-element nor neutral mind-originated things,” after each of the three permutations in § 1.)🔽An unwholesome, not mind-originated thing … (as above, in § 1, but with the addition of the third permutation, “neither mind-element nor neutral mind-originated things,” after each of the three permutations in § 1.)

original: Abyākataṁ nocittasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nanocittasamuṭṭhāno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: abyākatam no citta samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na no citta samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: A neutral, not mind-originated thing … (as above, in § 1, but with the addition of the third permutation, “neither mind-element nor neutral mind-originated things,” after each of the three permutations in § 1.)

original: Hetuyā terasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate terasa.
analyzed: hetuyā terasa ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate terasa
translated: In the section on root cause, there are thirteen. In the section on object, there are nine. … In the section on kamma result, there are three. … In the section on the inconstant, there are thirteen.
